<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// These are symbols used to throw/catch C++ exceptions and C longjmps. These</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// symbols have to be emitted somewhere once in the module. Check if each of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the symbols has already been created, i.e., we have at least one &#39;throw&#39; or</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#39;catch&#39; instruction with the symbol in the module, and emit the symbol only</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// if so.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// But in dynamic linking, it is in general not possible to come up with a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// module instantiating order in which tag-defining modules are loaded before</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the importing modules. So we make them undefined symbols here, define tags</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// in the JS side, and feed them to each importing module.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// name to share the common routines, a call site entry in the table corresponds</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to not a call site for possibly-throwing functions but a landing pad. In wasm</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// EH the VM is responsible for stack unwinding. After an exception occurs and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the stack is unwound, the control flow is transferred to wasm &#39;catch&#39;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instruction by the VM, after which the personality function is called from</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the compiler-generated code. Refer to WasmEHPrepare pass for more</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// information.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
